Two men posing as CID officers arrested.description: Rampur: Police have arrested two persons from Raipura village on Tuesday for allegedly trying to extort money by posing as CID officers. Civil Lines SHO Radhey Shyam said that a case was registered against Ehtesham and Sajid Ali, both residents of Ghaziabad, on charges of cheating and forgery. He added that the duo used to pose as CID officers and extort money. According to sources, the arrests were made after the accused approached Yusuf, village head of Raipura, demanding Rs 2 lakh. They even threatened to frame the village head in a murder case if they were not paid. Sources said that Yusuf then alerted police about the matter. The SHO said, “On information, we formed police teams to trap the conmen. They were caught red-handed when they visited the village again on Tuesday.” Ashutosh Tiwari, circle officer of Rampur, said, “They used to pose as CID and Intelligence Bureau officers to extort money from people. On Tuesday, several fake CID identity cards, stamps, walkie talkie sets, ATM cards and a toy pistol were seized from them.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

History-sheeter, cop injured in encounte.description: BAREILLY: History-sheeter Sameer, alias, Shahroz, aka, Dulhe Miyan, wanted in several criminal cases in Sambhal district, was arrested after an encounter on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, while his accomplice managed to flee taking advantage of darkness. In the gun battle, Sameer and police constable Kuldeep Kumar sustained bullet injuries and were admitted to hospital, where doctors proclaimed them out of danger. An FIR has been registered. According to police, a team was on a routine checking near Gavan village around 10pm when they signalled two youths astride a motorbike coming from Anupshahr side to stop. However, instead of following police directions, they sped up towards Sambhal. The police team soon alerted Hayatnagar police station and cops encircled them near Shakurpur village. However, the criminal opened fire at police, and a bullet struck constable Kuldeep Kumar on his left arm. Superintendent of police Yamuna Prasad said, “Police team also returned fire in their defence and nabbed one accused, while the other disappeared in cane fields. Sameer, who is wanted in several cases lodged against him, including cow slaughter, sustained bullet injuries in his leg.” Police seized a country-made pistol, live cartridges and a motorbike from Sameer’s possession. An FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) of the Indian penal Code (IPC) and relevant sections of the Arms Act was lodged against Sameer and his absconding accomplice. Three persons murdered, two injured in S.description: BAREILLY: People of Shahjahanpur district woke up to multiple murders on Saturday morning. The murders took place in two different locations on Friday night. The first incident took place in Katra where a man and his young son were shot at by the man’s elder brother over a property dispute. The youth succumbed to his injuries while his father was admitted to a district hospital. The second incident was reported from Shahjahanpur city at around 9.30pm where bike borne assailants fired multiple times at two persons who were standing near an eatery. Both the victims died on the spot while a passer-by sustained bullet injury. One of the deceased, identified as Gyandev (37), was recently released on bail from prison. He was charged under IPC section 307 (attempt to murder). An FIR has been filed against Sanjeev Gupta, Sonu Gupta, Amrish Gupta, Manoj Gupta and Ankur Gupta. Sanjeev was held with murder weapon on Saturday and police is currently interrogating him. According to police, Gyandev was a resident of Jamalpur village of Roza. He allegedly had enmity with local resident Sanjeev Gupta. On Friday night, Gyandev was returning home with his friend Rizwan (32) after dinner when Gupta along with his aides targeted him in the city’s Khirnibagh locality. This incident occurred within a distance of 200 metres from a police picket under Sadar Bazar police station limits. When the police arrived, Rizwan and Gyandev were lying dead on the road while Shanu, who was passing by, sustained bullet injury. Police immediately sent Shanu for treatment at a district hospital. Shanu’s condition is said to be stable. Gyandev was earlier charged for attempting to kill Amrish’s father Siyaram. Gyandev’s brother Hari Om had alleged that the killing of his brother was an “act of revenge”. SHO Sadar Bazar police station Kiranpal Singh told TOI, “Two persons were shot dead in Khirnibagh locality and we have filed an FIR against five persons. We have arrested one of the accused and his interrogation is on.” In Sultanpur village of Katra block, a youth identified as Anuj Gangwar (22) was shot dead by his uncle Hetram Gangwar while his father Ramasre sustained bullet injury. The accused fled after the incident. Ramasre was admitted to a district hospital where his condition is stable. An FIR has been filed against Hetram and two other persons. Search is currently on. The deceased’s family staged a protest and blocked the national highway on Saturday. The protest was soon over after police assured them that the accused were in their custody. SHO Katra police station Vidyut Goyal told TOI, “The deceased had won a court case against his uncle over a property dispute recently which triggered the incident. We have filed an FIR against three persons and all of them are in our custody. We will produce them in front of remand magistrate on Sunday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Boy, 14, dies after speeding bus hits bi.description: BAREILLY: A 14-year-old boy died on Friday after a private bus hit his bike which was stationed at Manauta-Saidnagali road near Shahpur Sirpuda village. According to police, the speeding bus dragged the motorbike and the boy up to 20 metres before the driver applied breaks. The driver later fled the scene and the boy died on the spot. After the incident, scores of villagers gathered there and blocked the traffic movement, which was restored after three hours post the intervention of area circle officer Chandausi Poonam Mishra and sub-divisional magistrate Dipendra Yadav. The officials promised to take action and sent the body for post-motem examination. The deceased has been identified as Arun, a resident of Amroha. SHO Asmauli Rakesh Kumar said an FIR has been filed under sections 304 (culpable homicide) and 337 (rash driving) of the IPC against the unidentified bus driver and his bus has been seized. Widening of Faridpur-Satellite road comm.description: BAREILLY: With the construction work of the upcoming Satellite flyover gaining momentum, the Uttar Pradesh State Bridge Corporation (UPSBC) has also started widening the existing Satellite-Faridpur road. According to UPSBC officials, as the existing road is slightly narrower, to give commuters better travelling experience and to facilitate flyover construction, the corporation has taken up the widening work from both ends. The flyover construction work has already begun near Khurram Gautiya UPSBC assistant engineer Dilip Kumar said, “The work of flyover construction is underway at the Satellite junction and the corporation has now taken up the widening work of the connecting road. The road connecting the main junction with Faridpur-Shahjahanpur-Lucknow road is a bit narrower. With the flyover coming up in the area, we now need a wider road for the free flow of traffic.” “Earlier, inspections were conducted, and it was observed that the existing road, which will now be converted into service lanes after the flyover comes up, was narrower. Thus, we have commenced the road widening work from both sides.” According UPSBC sources, the work of piling and erecting pillars has been initiated at both ends of the flyover, while the work of constructing service lane will be taken up soon. Kumar said, “The corporation will soon take up the work of laying of service lanes on both the sides of the flyover, for which the road widening is necessary. Service lanes on both sides of the flyover will provide enough space for hassle-free traffic movement.” The 596-metre long and 7.5-metre wide flyover is being developed at a cost of Rs 26 crore. The proposal for the construction a flyover at Satellite Crossing with a budget of Rs 34 crore was sent to the state government for approval last year. However, the government had reduced the budget to Rs 26 crore. The upcoming flyover, which will connect Isaiyon ki Puliya and Faridpur-Lucknow road via Satellite junction, will have a single road for two-way traffic movement. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

UP govt doctors wear black band in solid.description: Lucknow: Government doctors across Uttar Pradesh on Friday wore black bands to express solidarity with their counterparts protesting violence against two of their colleagues in West Bengal. The step was taken in response to a call for a four-day nationwide protest by Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Friday. Dr Amit Singh, general secretary of Provincial Medical Services Association, UP, said, “Government doctors wore black bands while discharging their duties at various hospitals in the state. In the afternoon, a delegation of the doctors submitted a memorandum addressed to the Prime Minister through the district magistrate." In the memorandum, “We have demanded security for doctors so that they do not feel scared” while discharging their duties. He added that more than 18,700 doctors who are members of the Provincial Medical Services Association, UP took part in the protest. Junior doctors in West Bengal are on a strike since Tuesday after two of their colleagues were attacked by a mob and seriously injured at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata following the death of a 75-year-old patient who died of a cardiac arrest. The incident raised concerns regarding security of doctors. In Meerut, doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association, wore helmets and black badges in protest and demanded proper security for doctors so that they can work properly. “We condemn the incident and it is just sad that doctors who save people’s lives are being attacked. We need a safe and secure environment to function, or else we will not be able to admit any serious patients. This is because if there is a high probability of death of a person, the chances are that his family will be annoyed and might attack us,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Meerut Indian Medical Association (IMA) unit. As a mark of protest, doctors in Meerut wore helmets and black badges while they tended to their patients on Friday. “If our demands of providing adequate security to doctors are not met, then the doctors will go on strike. However, due to the protest, only common man suffers,” said Dr Jain, who condemned the incident and demanded strict action against the perpetrators of this heinous crime. Dr Raghvendra Sharma, vice-president of IMA's Bareilly unit, said “More than 25 doctors gathered on Friday and donned black ribbons on their arm. We have sent a mail to the Prime Minister's Office to condemn the Kolkata incident." In Pilibhit, a delegation of doctors associated with the IMA demanded constitution of a district-level committee comprising a senior police officer not below the rank of additional superintendent of police, the chief medical officer and a designated delegate of IMA to ensure safe working environment for medical professionals. The delegation was called for empowering this committee to review all cases of violence against doctors and enforce prompt legal action against the assailants. The delegation handed over a memorandum of demands to additional district magistrate, (finance and revenue), Atul Singh, which was addressed to the Prime Minister. “We have demanded a new legislation from the Prime Minister to protect doctors and their medical establishments from violence as everyone in the country has the right to work in a safe environment,” said Dr Deepak Kumar Gangwar, district general secretary of IMA in Pilibhit. OP Yadav, IMA secretary for Agra district said, “In solidarity with our colleagues in West Bengal, doctors wore a black ribbon on their arm and gathered at the district collectorate to handover a memorandum to the district magistrate and senior superintendent of police. They demanded adequate arrangement for strict implementation of the UP Medical Protection Act. Violence in hospitals adversely affects patient care and institutions will be reluctant to take up complicated and risky patients which will affect critical care. A national law against violence in hospitals has to be brought in urgently that should provide a minimum of seven years of imprisonment for hospital violence.” (With inputs from Ishita Bhatia from Meerut, Priyangi Agarwal from Bareilly, Keshav Agrawal from Pilibhit and Deepak Lavania from Agra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Underground fire in Uttar Pradesh forest.description: LAKHIMPUR KHERI: An underground fire in Mohammadi range forests of Uttar Pradesh left scores of neighbouring villagers panicked and puzzled. Smoke was seen gushing out through the cracks in the ground and at some places land had turned into embers, said residents of Bela Pahara and Muda Galib villages in South Kheri forest division. 72-year-old Hukum Singh of Muda Galib said he has never been witness to such a scene. He feared that the fire may damage his crops. Another villager, Bhai Lal (75), termed the scene as a natural miracle, which he had never heard of or seen earlier. Some villagers also mistook it as a volcanic incident. Soon after the incident was reported, officials rushed to the spot. "The incident is a natural phenomenon in which fire broke out in underground humus layer," Vikas Dubey, Tehsildar of Mohammadi, told PTI. "The land where the underground fire incident took place has been lying barren for several decades and dry leaves, twigs and branches from nearby jungles accumulated there and formed the underground humus layer," he said. He also spoke to local villagers who said that a few days back, they had burnt fire on the land. He said "the overground fire was put out but it unknowingly caught the humus layers which resulted in smoke emission from the cracks". Divisional Forest Officer of South Kheri, Sameer Kumar, said, "Forest officials were rushed to dig up trenches around the affected land to prevent its spread of the fire to the nearby forest." Terming it 'swamp pit fire', field director Dudhwa Ramesh Kumar Pandey said, "Swampy lands often develop underground holes in which organic matters accumulated and scorching heat sometimes result in such underground fire." Missing woman found in Himachal Pradesh.description: BAREILLY: It was a happy reunion for the family of a 40-year-old woman who met her husband and children after one-and-a-half-year on Tuesday. Last year, she went missing when her grandmother was taking her to a religious shrine as she was suffering from a mental illness. Somehow, the woman reached Himachal Pradesh and was admitted to a mental hospital there for treatment. A Bareilly-based social worker traced the woman, brought her to Bareilly and reunited her with family. A native of Nekpur locality, the woman went missing in January last year. Her husband Shiv Kamal, a labourer, said, “As she has been suffering from a mental illness, my grandmother took her to a religious place for seeking God’s blessings. However, she pushed my grandmother at the gate and fled. We searched for her everywhere but couldn’t find her.” The woman somehow went to Gauhar in Mandi district of Himachal Pradesh. Suffering from a memory lapse, she told police that her name as ‘Shabana’ but could not recall her address. On the order of local magistrate, she was admitted to Himachal Hospital for Mental Health and Rehabilitation in Shimla on January 21, 2018 as ‘Shabana’. After her condition improved following her treatment, she was able to recall her correct name and address. Shailesh Sharma, a psychologist and social worker, said, “After I learnt about her, our team shifted her to Shraddha Rehabilitation Foundation, Karjat, for her rehabilitation on May 26 this year. I brought her to Bareilly on Tuesday and reunited her with her family. Her husband and children were surprised to see her as they had no information of her for past one-and-a-half-year.” Kamal said, “We had no hope that we will get to see her again and we are happy that she is back home. Her condition has also improved following the treatment. My family is thankful to everyone who helped her to reach home safely.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Farmer hurt in explosion succumbs to.description: BAREILLY: After struggling for 10 days, a 45-year-old farmer who was grievously injured during a tiffin box explosion while ploughing his field along with his son on June 2 succumbed to injuries on Tuesday evening in hospital. Durvijay Singh - who had lost his hand down the elbow and three fingers of other hand - sustained injuries also in his stomach during the explosion. His son was also wounded, but he was discharged from the hospital next day of the admission. The incident happened at Chudaili village under Baheri police station jurisdiction here. Durvijay and his son Tekpal, 23, were admitted to a hospital by family members. During preliminary investigation, police had found land dispute between victim farmer and his elder brother behind the incident. On the basis of complaint registered with police by Tekpal, police have lodged an FIR under Section 307 (attempt to murder) of the IPC against his two uncles Mehul Singh, Krishanpal Singh and three cousins Chhotu, Pankaj and Sachin. Police said that they had detained two accused, but later let them go since no substantial evidences were found against them. SHO Dhananjay Singh told TOI, “We have added one more section 302 (murder) of IPC in the case after Durvijay Singh passed away on Tuesday evening. We are probing the case on all angles and accused will be arrested very soon.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Two killed in group clash in Uttar Prade.description: SHAHJAHANPUR: Two persons were killed and another was injured when two groups clashed over some dispute in Shahjahanpur district of Uttar Pradesh, police said on Saturday. Gyandev (35) and Rizvan (32) were killed in the clash near Bismil park here on Friday night, Superintendent of Police (City) Dinesh Tripathi said. The clash was between followers of Gyandev and Sonu Gupta. Gupta opened fire killing the two on the spot, the police said. The injured, identified as Shanu, has been admitted to a hospital, where his condition was stated to be stable. Gupta has been arrested, the police added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Poacher held with 9.5 kg of turtle calip.description: BAREILLY: In a joint operation by UP forest department, Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB), Wildlife Trust of India and police department, approximately 9.5 kilograms of tortoise calipee, considered a tasty delicacy, was seized in Madnapur area of Shahjahanpur district. One poacher was arrested. The poacher was identified as Sanju. He had earlier dodged UP STF and was operating in the area. Forest department is interrogating Sanju to gather more information about his gang. Various sections of Wildlife Protection Act have been slapped against him Sanju. Forest department officials will seek his custody from court to gather more information. Sanju was arrested from Kanjad basti area of Madnapur and believed to be a member of the Bawaria gang. The turtles were poached from the rivers and ponds in Shahjahanpur and Farrukhabad district. Conservator of forest, Bareilly division, Pinaki Prasad Singh told TOI, “It was a huge recovery. Conservator of forest (WCCB) HV Girish helped n giving right shape to this operation, which was carried out successfully. We are now collecting information about other poachers active in this area.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Three drown, three others missing on occ.description: Bareilly: Three people, including a seven-year-old boy, were drowned while taking a holy dip in the Ganga and Ramganga rivers on the occasion of Ganga Dussehra in Badaun on Wednesday. In neighbouring Sambhal, however, two children aged five and 14 years are feared drowned in the Ganga. Rescue operation is currently on. In the first incident, Abhishek Singh (9), son of Johari Singh and resident of Naugauna Nasirnagar village in Badaun, was taking a dip in the Ganga at Bhundi Ghat under Ushait police station when he was swept away by the water current and drowned. After locals raised an alarm, divers deployed by the district administration managed to take him out of the river and the boy was admitted to the community health centre (CHC) in Ushait, He was later referred to the district hospital, but died during treatment. Similarly, Rajendra, who was in his 30s, was drowned while taking a dip in the Ganga at Kacchla Ghat in Badaun on Wednesday. Rajendra, along with his family members had come to Badaun from Etah’s Avagadh village. Station house officer of Ujhani police station Vinod Kumar said, “Rajendra’s family took his body back to the village.” The third incident took place in Chitri village under Hazratpur police station of Badaun, where Sonu, alias, Vijay Kumar (25), was drowned in Ramganga while taking a dip. Local divers swung into action immediately and took him out. “Sonu was admitted to the district hospital, but he died while being treated,” said Rakesh Chauhan, station house officer, Hazratpur police station. In Sambhal district, five-year-old Anshu and Sunil Kumar (14) were feared drowned in the Ganga in separate incidents. Rescue operations were going on till the filing of this report. In Hardoi, a 14-year-old boy was drowned and two other teenagers went missing after they were swept away by river current while taking a holy dip on the occasion of Ganga Dussehra at Shiasar ghat under Arwal police station area on Wednesday, police said. The body of Divyansh (14) was fished out, while search is on for Shivam (15) and Mithun (15), said additional superintendent of police Gyanjay Singh. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed grief over the loss of lives. According to a statement issued in Lucknow, CM Yogi has directed officials to intensify rescue operations and trace the boys. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Five killed, eight injured in tempo-.description: BAREILLY: Five persons, including two women and a 5-year-old child, were killed and eight others injured when a pick-up truck collided with a tempo near here. The accident took place in Khailam village under Aliganj police station, police said on Friday. The injured have been admitted to the district hospital, where the condition of two of them is said to be critical, they added. UP irrigation \mMinister Dharampal Singh rushed to the district hospital on getting the information about the accident. "The driver of the pick-up truck has been arrested, said Superintendent of Police (Rural) Sansar Singh. He identified deceased as Shriwati (45), Krishnapal (30), Mamta (27) and Mamta's son Keshav (5). The identity of the fifth deceased is yet to be ascertained, he said. Seven blocks on Bareilly-Badaun border w.description: BAREILLY: Most of the malaria cases being reported since January, have been detected in three blocks of Bareilly and four blocks of Badaun on either side of the Bareilly-Badaun border, according to officials of the health department here. The cases are on the rise, they added. According to data available with the health department, 2,418 cases of plasmodium vivax (PV) malaria and 244 cases of “deadly” plasmodium falciparum (PF) malaria were detected from January to May in Bareilly district. Of these, 1,972 cases of PV and 130 cases of PF were reported only in May. Similarly, 941 cases of PV and 17 of PF occurred from January to May in Badaun. Out of total cases, 649 cases of PV and two cases of PF were detected in May in Badaun. PF malaria, which is considered as rare in the region, can be fatal if treatment is delayed beyond 24 hours after the onset of clinical symptoms, said officials. However, PV malaria is one of the common variants of the disease and is usually reported in the region. According to officials, cases of malaria are being reported from across Bareilly and Badaun but a majority of the patients who have tested positive hail from Majhgavan, Bhamora and Ramnagar blocks of Bareilly and Dataganj, Samrer, Jagat and Binawar blocks of Badaun. Both Bareilly and Badaun had reported outbreak of malaria last year and health experts said the number of cases are expected to go up during monsoon. Bareilly district malaria officer D R Singh said, “As the maximum temperature is hovering around 40 degrees centigrade, most of the waterlogged pits have dried up due to intense heat. It has affected breeding of mosquitoes and reduced their density. We are utilizing this time by screening more patients and giving them immediate treatment. If malaria parasite is removed from the bodies of locals, there will be less possibility of the disease from spreading in monsoon when mosquito breeding will be at its peak.” Badaun district malaria officer Vinod Kumar Sharma said, “We are conducting indoor residual spray at 173 sensitive villages of the four affected blocks of district. Our teams are holding health camps in villages for diagnosis and treatment of people. Besides, district magistrate has ordered the panchayati raj department and village heads to ensure cleanliness to contain mosquito breeding.” Indoor residual spray is also underway in Bareilly’s 218 sensitive villages. Officials said the specialty of indoor residual spray with DDT is that if a mosquito sits on a wall, it dies. The spray is effective for 75 days. Two minors raped in west UP districts.description: BAREILLY: In yet another case of crime against minor in western UP, an eight-year-old girl was raped by a youth in a village under the Nawabganj police station on Wednesday when the girl was going to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. While in Shahjahanpur district, a 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two youths after breaking into her house in a village under Khutara police station limits. The crime is said to have occurred on June 7, but police allegedly didn’t lodge any complaint turning her parents away when they reached the police station. The FIR was only lodged after the girl’s parents met the superintendent of police S Chinnapa on Thursday and he instructed the station house officer to do so. In the case under the Nawabganj police station, the accused man, who came on a bicycle, told her that her father was calling her to the field and took her to a secluded place where he allegedly raped her and fled after dropping her near the house. Police have lodged an FIR and are conducting raids to nab the accused. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said that the rape survivor’s father and uncle had gone to the field leaving her at home with her mother. She remained silent and narrated her ordeal to her mother in the evening only after she started having pain in her private parts and lower abdomen. “The accused was caught in a college CCTV camera while carrying the girl on a bicycle. We have scanned the CCTV camera footage. His face was not clear,” the SP said. The SP added that they had set up three teams to nab the accused. “Since the girl didn’t object while going with the accused on his bicycle, it seems that he was from the same village and known to her. The girl has been sent for medical examination. An FIR has been lodged under section 376 and POCSO Act,” the SP said. In Shahjahanpur district, the survivor’s father, in his police complaint, stated that her daughter was alone at home when two youths – Vikram and Nikku – barged into their house in the evening. They were carrying a sword and a country-made pistol. Threatening the girl both of them took turns to rape her. Both the accused fled the scene after the arrival of the girl’s parents. They even threatened to kill the parents if they complained against them. The SP said that an FIR under section 376 D (gang rape) of IPC and POCSO Act had been lodged. They were conducting raids to nab the accused. SHO Sanjay Singh said, “We had received the complaint and lodged FIR after investigation. The girl has been sent for medical examination and raids are on to arrest both the accused.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five hurt in LPG lantern blast.description: BAREILLY: At least five women sustained burn injuries in LPG lantern explosion in Sambhal district’s Pali village under jurisdiction of Asmauli police station on Friday evening. The women were sitting in the veranda of one Kuldeep Kumar’s home when the lantern exploded. Three of the injured have been referred to higher medical facility in critical condition. The injured women have been identified as Kuldeep’s wife Pushpa, his mother Sheela, and three sisters-in-law Babita, Beena and Nirvesh. Upon hearing explosion, neighbours came running to the spot and informed the emergency ambulance services 108. Station house officer (SHO) of Asmauli police station Rakesh Kumar said all injured were shifted to hospital, where doctors referred Pushpa, Babita and Beena to higher medical facility with 70% burn injuries. “Three women in serious condition have been referred to a higher medical facility in Moradabad, while the remaining two are said to be out of danger,” said SHO. More than 15,000 tourists visit PTR sinc.description: PILIBHIT: Eco-tourism season came to an end on Saturday as Pilibhit Tiger Reserve (PTR) closed for the monsoon. The reserve will reopen on November 15. The season that opened from November 15, 2018 to June 15, 2019, saw an increase in both footfall as well as revenue as against the previous season. Although the current year’s eco-tourism marked an increase in overall revenue and footfall in comparison to the previous season, it fell short of the figures registered in 2016-17, when the jungle tourism was under the direct command and control of PTR administration. The management of jungle tourism is now in the hands of UP Forest Corporation. The revenue earned through jungle tourism has been transferred by the PTR administration to the account of UP Forest Corporation. The current season’s figures reveal that Chuka was visited by as many as 15,885 Indian and 23 foreign tourists generating a total revenue of over Rs 36 lakh. The huts at Chuka were booked by 209 tourists for night stay, the highest figure so far. In the 2017-18 season, 14,885 tourists visited PTR generating a revenue of over Rs 32 lakh. In comparison to this, in 2016-17, PTR saw 16,360 footfall and maximum-ever revenue to the tune of over Rs 37 lakh. Asked why PTR could not match the 2016-17 figures, reserve’s deputy director Adarsh Kumar said that this could be an outcome of sharp hike in entry fee and rates of huts at Chuka. Asked why a tiger foundation had not been set up in PTR as in other reserves, Kumar said the proposal had been sent to the state forest administration on February 17 , 2016 for approval and is still pending. Once the tiger foundation is set up, all eco-tourism revenue will be deposited with it and PTR can use the funds on its own. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Bareilly farmer hurt in tiffin bomb expl.description: BAREILLY: A 45-year-old farmer who had sustained grievous injuries in a tiffin box explosion recently succumbed at a hospital here on Tuesday evening. According to sources, Durvijay and his son Tekpal had sustained injuries when a tiffin box exploded while they were ploughing fields in Chudaili village under Baheri police jurisdiction on June 2. Preliminary inquiry had revealed that a land dispute between the victim and his elder brother was the reason behind the crime. Sources said that while Durvijay’s arm had to be cut off below the elbow along with three fingers, his son sustained only minor injuries and was discharged the next day. Based on a complaint lodged by Tekpal, police had registered a case against his two uncles Mehul Singh and Krishanpal Singh, and three cousins Chottu, Pankaj and Sachin under section 307(attempt to murder) of IPC. Baheri SHO Dhananjay Singh said that they have added section 302 (murder) of IPC also to the FIR after Durvijay succumbed on Tuesday. “We are investigating the case and are on the lookout for the accused,” he added. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. 17-year-old held for raping 8-year-old g.description: BAREILLY: A 17-year-old boy was arrested on Thursday for allegedly raping an 8-year-old girl in a village under jurisdiction of Nawabganj police station in Bareilly. According to police, the incident took place on Wednesday when the minor girl had gone out to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. They said the accused took the girl to a secluded place and raped her. He later fled the spot after dropping the girl near to her house. Later, when the girl felt pain in her private parts and lower abdomen, she narrated her ordeal to her mother after which a case was filed. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said, “We had gone through CCTV camera footage that was installed at a nearby college which is close to the place where the incident took place. During investigation, we detained two persons and called the girl to identify the accused. After he was identified, we took the juvenile into the custody. During interrogation, the accused confessed to his crime.” Station house officer of Nawabganj, inspector Rajesh Kumar Singh, said that after producing the accused in the court, he was sent to the juvenile centre on Friday. SHO Rajesh Kumar Singh added, “The accused juvenile, was previously in a juvenile home for raping a girl in 2017. He was released seven months ago.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Trench dug to contain sub-surface fire i.description: BAREILLY: Forest department and district administration on Saturday dug up a trench with the help of JCB machines in the forest area of Mohammadi range in Lakhimpur Kheri district to contain the sub-surface fire raging there. The officials claimed that they had managed to control the sub-surface fire and would douse it soon. They said there was no threat to wildlife, flora or people living in the nearby villagers. On Friday, villagers spotted smoke billowing out of the ground in the forest land near Belpahada village under Mohammadi block. When they rushed to the spot, they saw cracks in the soil and flames beneath it were clearly visible. The ground was hot. Forest department officials were called and they identified the phenomenon as sub-surface fire. Sub-surface fires are of low intensity, consuming organic matter beneath and surface litter of forest floor, including plant roots, humus and peat. This fire spreads very slowly and in most cases, it becomes very hard to detect and control such type of fires. They may continue to burn for months and destroy vegetative cover of the soil. On Saturday, JCB machines were deployed in the area to dig up a trench on the ground where the fire was visible. After digging over two feet, a layer of sand was visible. After this discovery, officials were assured that the underground fire had not been very intense and could be doused by showering water on it. Divisional forest official, South Kheri forest division, Samir Kumar monitored the operation and remained in the forest for several hours. He assured villagers of the nearby villages that the fire was not a threat to them. He told TOI, “The fire had not spread deep inside the forest area like it happens in areas around coal mines. We will be able to douse it completely soon. Soil experts have also paid a visit to the forest area and the situation is under our control." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shahjahanpur to tap gau shakti to make o.description: BAREILLY: In a bid to make use of stray cattle herded in cow shelters, Shahjahanpur administration has come up with an innovative plan to use their urine and dung to manufacture a range of organic products. It also hopes that once owners learn about their usefulness, they will not abandon their cattle, which left unattended become a menace for all. It is proposed to manufacture beauty products like organic gau-ubtan (face pack), bio pesticides, organic fertilizers, agarbatti (incense sticks), soap and cow dung cakes from cow urine and dung. . These products will be marketed under the name, ‘Gau-Shakti’, said government officials. The idea is to ensure that people identify the economic value of bovines even if they are not giving milk or ploughing the fields, they added. “Keeping a cow even if it is not giving milk is useful as the dung of a single animal in a year can produce bio-fertilizers and bio-pesticides for 30 acres of agricultural land,” said chief development officer Mahendra Singh Tanwar. Making an announcement to the effect, Amrit Tripathi, DM of Shahjahanpur, distributed gau-shakti kits to 313 couples who tied the knot at a mass wedding ceremony on Sunday. “These products are expected to see a proper launch within a month and may hit online stores soon. The revenue generated from these products will be used for running effectively cattle shelters here,” he added.. In order to implement the idea, district administration took the support of Sanjay Upadhyaya, a chemical engineer who has devoted his life for conservation of stray cattle. After conducting experiments with cow dung and urine, he has developed new products which can be used in day-to-day life like tooth powder, tooth paste and bio-fertilizers. Giving details about the project, Tripathi told TOI, “We are trying to come up with a brand of products made from cow dung and cow urine. These products will be known as Gau-Shakti. The products made from cow dung and urine already have has good demand in the market and it will help us to generate revenue, which can be used for running cow shelters. Also, several people will get employment if these projects prove to be a success.” CDO Tanwar said, “During the Vedic era, the cow was considered sacred and every produce of a cow was utilized. Very few people know that keeping a cow means ‘zero budgeting agriculture’ as fertilizers and organic pesticides can be prepared from the cow dung and its urine. If people become aware about such products derived from cow dung and urine, then they may stop abandoning their cattle.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

"Another strike on Pakistan by team India and the result is the same. Congratulations to the entire team for this superb performance. Every Indian is feeling proud and celebrating this impressive win," Shah said in a tweet. Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Madrassas don\u2019t produce Godse, Prag.description: Rampur: Responding to the central government’s plan to connect madrassas to mainstream education, Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Mohammad Azam Khan on Tuesday evening said that Muslim educational institutions do not breed people with Nathuram Godse’s nature or with a personality like Pragya Singh Thakur. The Rampur MP-elect told TOI, “They should first announce that those propagating thoughts of Nathuram Godse will be declared enemies of democracy, and those convicted for terror activities won’t be rewarded. It is a matter of grave concern that a person booked for terror activity has now become a lawmaker.” The SP leader alleged that people like him who always work in the field of education, opening schools and universities are booked under fake charges. Pragya Thakur, an accused in the 2008 Malegaon blasts and out on bail, won the recent Lok Sabha election from Bhopal on a BJP ticket. She remained in the news for claiming that Godse, who killed Mahatma Gandhi in 1948, was a “patriot”. Union minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, while announcing a scheme, had said, “Madrassas are in large numbers across the country. They will be connected with formal education and mainstream education so that those children studying there can also contribute in the development of society.” Azam Khan added, “Apart from religious education, English, Hindi and mathematics are being taught in madrassas for years. It is nothing new. If they want to help, they should improve facilities in madrasas. In schools, we have failed to provide furniture and thousands of students still study under a tree in many villages. Provide furniture and salary to teachers in madrassas. Unlike other schools, madrassa students have been deprived of mid-day meal.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

CO who stopped Mohammad Azam Khan from d.description: RAMPUR: City circle officer Ashutosh Tiwari, who had stopped Samajwadi Party MP-elect Mohammad Azam Khan from delivering a speech in Rampur Fort after his election to the Lok Sabha, was attached with the office of the DGP in Lucknow on Thursday. Speaking with TOI, Rampur, superintendent of police Ajay Pal Sharma said, “City circle officer Ashutosh Tiwari has been attached with the DGP office in Lucknow.” The official letter, however, did not mention reason for the transfer, he added. Azam Khan along with his supporters had staged a protest against the police officers after he was stopped from delivering a speech, thanking his voters.
