Sub-surface fire rages in Kheri forest a.description: Bareilly: After news of smoke billowing out of the ground in the forest land near Belpahada village of Mohammadi block in Lakhimpur Kheri district spread, locals started gathering in the area on Friday. Soon a team of forest and administrative officials visited the spot and found that the smoke was a result of sub-surface fire. Sub-surface fires are of low intensity, consuming organic matter beneath and surface litter of forest floor, including plant roots, humus and peat. This fire spreads very slowly and in most of the cases, it becomes very hard to detect and control such type of fires. They may continue to burn for months and destroy vegetative cover of the soil. There are four revenue villages in the radius of two kilometers from the forest land. This has sparked fears that if not controlled, the sub-surface fire will consume forest wealth, affect wildlife and people living in the vicinity. According to local villagers, they observed smoke in Jamuniaghat beat of Mohammadi forest area, spanning 25 acres. There were cracks in the soil and flames beneath the soil were clearly visible. The ground was hot. Bur forest department assured villagers that necessary action would be taken to douse the sub-surface fire at the earliest. Divisional forest officer, South Kheri forest division, Samir Kumar informed his superiors about the fire so that steps can be taken for preventing any damage to forest and human habitat. Mohammadi forest range is a social forest region but has carnivores and herbivores along with rich flora. Tehsildar Vikas Dhar Dube, who also visited the village with his team, said, “We are inspecting the area to identify if such signs are visible elsewhere.” Kumar told TOI, “This could be an extremely dangerous situation as we are not aware about the total area where the underground fire has spread. We are planning to dig a large pit using JCB machines to douse the underground fire. However, it will be done after seeking permission from seniors and receiving expert advice. Our priority is to ensure safety of flora and fauna of the forest and that of local people. As of now, we have advised locals to stay away from the area.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

After delivering stillborn, woman \u2018.description: BAREILLY: A 26-year-old woman fell to death from third floor of a government women’s hospital under mysterious circumstances where she was admitted recently. The woman, a resident of Laharpur Balia village under Bhamora police station jurisdiction, had delivered a stillborn baby on June 9. Family of the deceased woman said that she was suffering from severe depression after learning about her stillborn baby. However, doctors are not ready to accept this theory and the matter has been referred to police for a probe. The incident took place at around 4:30 am. Dr Alka Sharma, chief medical superintendent (CMS) of government women’s hospital, said that it was a caesarean delivery and she was shocked to know how she could climb up to the third floor. “The woman was admitted to a maternity ward on the first floor which is completely covered from all sides. A woman who has undergone caesarean delivery cannot walk even for 10 steps without help from others, within a week of the surgery. It is indeed a matter of investigation now. The body has been handed over to the police for post-mortem examination,” the CMS said. The CMS also said that the hospital staff informed her about the incident at 4:51 am. Doctors said that since the woman was very upset after the delivery, they had allowed her husband and mother in-law to stay with her as attendants. While station house officer of Kotvali, Pankaj Tyagi, said that they would examine the CCTV footage to ascertain who was with the woman when she climbed the third floor. Notably, the woman was married only a year ago. Her mother in-law said, “My daughter in-law was suffering from severe depression after giving birth to a stillborn. She used to start crying after seeing other women with newborn babies in the maternity ward. I was sleeping when she went out of the ward and I immediately informed the ward boy as soon as I realised that she was missing.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Village head\u2019s hubby killed by his.description: BAREILLY: The decapitated body of Sabir Khan, the husband of Rampura Maafi village head Ayesha Khan, who had been missing since Friday evening, was on Sunday found in forest area under jurisdiction of Bhojipura police station here. Police suspected that Faruq Khan, a resident of the same village, had killed Sabir as the latter had “illicit” relationship with the former’s sister. Sabir’s wife Ayesha had lodged a missing FIR at Bhojipura police station on Saturday. Sabir was a transporter, who had gone out in connection with his business on Friday, but did not return. After the FIR, police sought his mobile location and call detail records (CDRs), and later detained Faruq. According to police, during interrogation, Faruq purportedly accepted his crime. Station house officer (SHO) of Bhojipura police station Rajesh Kumar told TOI, “Faruq confessed that he shot dead Sabir and dumped his decapitated body in the forest area.” Meanwhile, police are trying to identify other persons who helped Faruq in the murder and also gathering evidence. SHO said, “We have arrested Faruq in this connection and trying to identify if anyone else was involved in the murder. We will share further details after collecting evidence.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cops stop Mohammad Azam Khan from speech.description: RAMPUR: Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Mohammad Azam Khan asked the police to arrest him and his supporters after Rampur city circle officer Ashutosh Tiwari and SHO Kothwali Sadar Anil Kumar stopped the Rampur MP-elect from delivering his ‘thanksgiving speech’ inside the city’s historical fort ground on Tuesday evening. The ‘thanksgiving’ event was organised after Azam Khan had defeated Jaya Prada, the BJP candidate, by more than one lakh votes, in the recent Lok Sabha elections. In high drama, when the circle officer showed his watch and gestured towards Azam Khan to stop his speech, the SP leader on the stage, with both hands together asked the police to get him ‘handcuffed’. “Please arrest me and all my supporters. Arrest us right now.” Thousands of Azam Khan’s supporters, who had gathered at the venue, turned rowdy and started raising slogans against the police personnel. Azam Khan then took the microphone again and appealed his supporters to “stay calm”. Azam Khan told TOI, “Three minutes were still left when the circle officer asked me to stop. This is against the freedom of speech and expression. It is an attack on the fundamental right guaranteed by the Constitution of India.” He claimed, “The administrative officials want a ‘bloodbath’ like situation in Rampur. It is part of a conspiracy. I’m being targeted since I’m a strong opposition face.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Blaming cops of inaction, rape survi.description: BAREILLY: Blaming police of inaction, a 24-year-old rape survivor, who had been running from pillar to post to get a case registered, allegedly committed suicide in a village under Dataganj police station area of Badaun district on Sunday. In her suicide note, the woman, who hung herself to death, blamed the police for the extreme step. The victim stated that she was married two years ago and had been living with her parents since February, after her health deteriorated. “On May 15, when I was on my way home after visiting a doctor, one of my relatives met me at a bus stand and told me that my husband was not well and I must come with him to see my husband. Two people were already accompanying the relative. Believing them, I sat in his car, but they forcefully took me to Secunderabad in Telangana and confined me to a house,” the woman stated in her suicide note. “They raped me for a week and snatched all my jewellery and mobile phone, leaving me helpless. I could not even contact my family. One day, when they were taking me to Delhi in a train, I called my father using the mobile phone of a co-passenger and gave him Delhi’s address where they were taking me,” the suicide note further stated. The victim also stated that it was her father who made her free from the clutches of her tormentors and took her home in Badaun. The victim had alleged that she had given written complaints to Dataganj police station SHO, Badaun SSP and Bareilly zone ADG, but none of them paid heed to her plight. “I love my husband a lot. Since I was raped, my husband left me. I am left with no other option, except ending my life,” she concluded in the note. SSP Ashok Kumar Tripathi told TOI, “When she approached Dataganj police, they advised her to lodge an FIR in Secunderabad as the crime was committed there. Then the woman met ADG on June 12, following which we were instructed to lodge an FIR. After probing into the matter, we booked the three accused.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sambhal municipal chairperson\u2019s son.description: BAREILLY: Sambhal municipality chairperson Arifa Shaqil’s son Hasnain has been booked for allegedly brandishing a pistol and threatening to kill former chairperson Nusrat Ilahi’s cousin Salman after the later posted pictures of garbage piles on social media and accused Shaqil for city’s ugly look. In his police complaint, Salman stated that he was on his way home around 9pm in Saraitarin locality under jurisdiction of Hayatnagar police station when Hanain and his two accomplices, who were travelling in a car, waylaid his motorbike. “He held me at gunpoint and abused me, and threatened me of dire consequences if I ever complain or post any message on social media against his mother and municipality officials,” said Salman. As locals came out of their houses hearing my screams, seeing them, Hasnain and his accomplices fled the scene, added Salman. Station house officer (SHO) Hayatnagar police station Ranveer Singh said, “An FIR has been registered against Hasnain and two others, and we are probing the matter.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BMC corporators intensify protest agains.description: BAREILLY: Corporators of Bareilly Municipal Corporation (BMC), who have been agitating for long against the allegations of corruption leveled against fellow councellor Vinod Saini by municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N, on Saturday intensified their protest and burned effigy of the official. According to the information from BMC, 44 BJP councellors and even some from Samajwadi Party (SP), Congress, Independents and others joined the agitation and submitted a memorandum to Bareilly mayor Umesh Gautam. Corporators said that they want municipal commissioner to take back his FIR and tender an apology. BJP corporator Vinod Saini said, “Bareilly municipal commissioner has put up allegations of corruption against me and has accused me of doing misconduct in portable shop project. The allegations are simply to defame me and to give a wrong message in public. Under BMC’s portable shop project, from making shop layout, giving contract, setting up sample shops in BMC premises to distribution of keys among vendors, everything has been done under guidance of senior officials in BMC. And yet, allegations of corruption have been made against me, unnecessarily. The senior official has lodged FIR against me under two-three sections. I have been serving my duty in Nagar Nigam for several years and never came across any such thing. I strongly condemn this action and want him to publically apologise.” Abdul Qayyum Khan, a SP corporator for four years from ward 69 (Koharapir), told TOI, “Municipal commissioner has lodged FIR against our mate Vinod Saini and has made allegations of corruption which is not true. We have submitted a memorandum to the mayor informing that development works in BMC will only be resumed after municipal commissioner takes back his complaint and publically apologise for his behaviour and defaming of our colleague. We will intensify the agitation and stage dharna at Nagar Nigam entrance and will not let any official enter the premises from Monday onwards.” Corporators alleged that they had submitted a memorandum at municipal commissioner’s office on June 1 regarding the same demands but nothing happened. Besides, with councellors protesting, development works - including cleaning of drains, maintenance of roads and other important works to be conducted ahead of monsoon - are put on hold. “Now, we have submitted a fresh memorandum to mayor and have informed that if our demand is not met, we will stage protest at BMC entrance and ensure that no official enters the premises from Monday. Official chores will only be resumed after we are heard,” added Khan. Bareilly municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N had earlier lodged an FIR against Saini following a heated argument between the two, according to information from BMC. The FIR has been lodged under section 406 (punishment for criminal breach of trust) and section 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) of IPC. When TOI contacted municipal commissioner Samuel Paul N, he was unavailable for comment. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Notice served on four people, hospital a.description: BAREILLY: At a time when health authorities are making all-out efforts to contain rising malaria cases in Bareilly district, the threat of dengue also looms large over the city. The health department has served notice to four people and a private hospital after finding larvae of Aedes mosquitos in their premises. Aedes mosquito causes dengue. Officials said they will start a drive against private hospitals in Rampur Garden to check if Aedes larvae are present or not. However, so far, no positive case of dengue has been reported this year but officials said the vertor–borne dengue will spread during monsoon. Last year, a few private hospitals had reported suspected dengue cases but officials here confirmed that only two patients tested positive. According to health officials, when a team conducted random inspections, it found larvae of Aedes mosquito in the premises of four people residing in quarters near Shyamatganj flyover. The team also found larvae in a private hospital situated on Stadium road. D R Singh, district malaria officer, said, “We have served notice to people on whose house or hospital larvae was found. They have been asked to maintain cleanliness. Our team will again inspect these places after a week. If they are again found flouting rules, we will ask Bareilly Municipal Corporation to impose a fine on them.” Meanwhile, the health department has been conducting a survey on density of mosquito pre-monsoon and post-monsoon in several parts of the district to ascertain which areas are more prone to vector-borne diseases. During the survey, no mosquitoes were found at Ghatpuri village under Binawar block of Badaun and Jagat community health centre of Badaun. Officials said the density of mosquitoes will go up after the rains. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Public transport drivers take oath to ob.description: Bareilly: Bareilly traffic police department recently organized a special workshop for public transport drivers at Police Lines here on Saturday. The drivers were sensitized about traffic rules. A special programme was conducted wherein drivers of auto rickshaws and e-rickshaws took a pledge to obey various traffic regulations including driving within speed limits, not overloading their vehicles and driving under the influence of alcohol.Speaking with TOI, superintendent of police (traffic) Subhash Gangwar said, “A special workshop was organized here to make drivers of public transport aware of the need for following traffic rules and regulations. The special workshop was attended by around 200 public transport drivers, including drivers of e-rickshaws auto-rickshaws, tempos and roadways buses. Apart from apprising them about traffic norms, drivers were also made to pledge that they would obey traffic rules.” The SP added, “Drivers were asked to adhere to traffic rules such as not halting vehicles randomly on the road, picking or dropping passengers from at least 50 metres from main junctions or trisections, not parking vehicles in a manner that free traffic movement is hampered, not ferrying passengers above the actual limit of the vehicle, not speeding and driving under the influence of alcohol.” Meanwhile, a number of traffic violators were issued challans for flouting traffic rules . A sum of Rs 1,15,000 was recovered as fine from the violators.According to traffic police officials, traffic rule violation has become rampant in the city with drivers of both public and private vehicles indulging in various offenses including speeding, overloading, not carrying a valid driving licence, jumping signals, illegal parking and wrong side driving. To keep a check on rampant violation of rules, random enforcement drives are also being launched in the city. Soon, drives will be launched against erring three-wheeler drivers, having rural permits, but operating within city limits. Legal action will be initiated against such drivers, said the officials. Last month, Bareilly traffic police had issued challans to as many as 110 public transport drivers in a span of two days for causing jams near prominent junctions and roads during one such drive.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven people die in two separate acciden.description: BAREILLY: As many as 7 people died in two separate accidents on Friday in Bareilly district. The first accident took place in Fatehganj east area where the car of food inspector Kapil Dev Rishipal crashed into a tractor trailer coming from the opposite direction. Rishipal and his driver Prem Shankar sustained critical injuries and were rushed to a private hospital where the doctor declared both of them brought dead. Rishipal was a resident of Bareilly and was posted in Roza area of Shahjahanpur district. He was on his way to Shahjahanpur. The second accident took place in Aliganj area where five persons died and three injured when a pick-up van rammed into a tempo coming from opposite direction. Unfortunately, a couple, identified as Suraj and his wife Shreevati, also came in contact with the crashed vehicles while riding a bi-cycle, leading to the death of Shreevati. According to police, both the vehicles were over-speeding. They all were rushed to district hospital in Bareilly by police where two of them succumbed to injuries. The bodies were sent for autopsy and their families have been informed. Apart from Shreevati (30) the decased in the Aliganj accident were identified as Kunwar Pal (26), Mamta Devi (28), her nephew Keshav (5). The survivors undergoing treatment at the district hospital were identified as Suraj Kumar (32) and Ajay Kumar (16). Additional SP (rural) Sansaar Singh said, “Seven people were killed in the rural areas in two accidents. We have registered FIR in both the cases against the driver under IPC sections 379 (rash driving) and 304 a (causing death by negligence). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CWC seeks DNA report of \u2018disowned\u.description: BAREILLY: The Child Welfare Committee (CWC) has directed police to submit the DNA test report of the premature “disowned” baby girl, who has been suffering from hyperthyroid clitoris and fighting for her life a private hospital here. The baby’s family had on May 28 alleged that staff of the private hospital, where she has been undergoing treatment, at present, had changed their newborn son with a girl. The hospital authorities, however, claimed that as “the baby is suffering from rare hypertrophied clitoris, and due to abnormal enlargement of clitoris at the time of birth, the family assumed their newborn girl as a boy”. DN Sharma, member/ magistrate, CWC, said, “I have asked the investigating officer to submit the DNA report at the earliest so that we can verify about her parents. Police will bear the cost of her DNA test. Meanwhile, the child’s father recorded his statement on Tuesday, while the mother didn’t come. I have asked the family to submit an affidavit in the matter on Thursday so that we may give the child for adoption in the future. The baby’s condition is improving.” Balvir Singh, station house officer, Premnagar police station, said, “We will need the parents’ permission for DNA test and blood samples of parents and the newborn.” According to family, a premature baby boy was born at the private hospital in Rampur’s Milak on May 6 from just six-and-a-half-month of pregnancy, but after the child’s condition deteriorated, they admitted him to the nursery of a private hospital in Bareilly’s Janakpuri after four hours later. Horilal, a farmer based in Raj Dadiya village of Rampur, had earlier claimed, “When the hospital authorities gave the child to us on May 28, they said it is a girl. But, we had admitted a boy, which is also mentioned in the admission form. The hospital has exchanged our son with someone’s daughter.” Dr Santosh Singh, director, private hospital, had earlier said, “The clerical staff, who manages the counter, had asked about the baby’s gender for entry in the admission form and wrote male after the child’s parents told him. But, during examination, it came to light that the baby is a girl and has been suffering from rare hypertrophied clitoris. “Due to abnormal enlargement of clitoris, the family and the place where she was born, assumed her as a boy. After examination, our staff had informed about the gender of the baby to the family, who gave their written consent for further treatment. Thus, the charges levelled by the family are baseless, because how and where could have we got a baby of the same weight and condition!” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encroachments on 35 hectares in DTR buff.description: Bareilly: Encroachment over around 35 hectares of forest land in buffer area of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve (DTR), which was illegally occupied by farmers over the period of four decades, has been removed, and forest officials have decided to do plantation in the evacuated area.According to data accessed by TOI, DTR buffer area is spread over around 74,000 hectares, of which 9,200 hectares have been encroached upon. Last year, the forest department had removed squatters from around 100 hectares.Divisional forest officer, DTR buffer zone division, Anil Patel said, “We have removed encroachment from over 35 hectares in Bodhiya forest block under Majhgai range of buffer zone division. After taking possession of the evacuated land, we have demarcated it with the help of the revenue department. We have set up a target of removing encroachment from over more than 100 hectares this year. The action against squatters is underway.”Forest staff carried out the anti-encroachment drive with the help of special tiger protection force (STPF) and police.Forest officials said most of the encroachers are farmers who grow sugarcane and paddy on forest land. As the boundary at some places is not clear, farmers took advantage and encroached upon forest land, they said.Patel said, “After removing encroachment, we are demarcating the boundary by erecting pillars. Last year, I had written to the district sugarcane officer, urging him not to issue licence for the crushing of sugarcane to those farmers who have been growing their crop illegally on forest land. However, two farmers approached the high court in this connection and the matter is subjudice.”Ramesh Pandey, field director, DTR, said, “We have decided to carry out plantation on the evacuated land so that encroachers do not occupy the land again.”According to sources, forest officials have set up a target of planting 9.5 lakh saplings in the DTR buffer zone division, of which around 8.2 lakh saplings have already been planted.They said forest officials would plant thousands of saplings in the evacuated forest area.In the meantime, besides erecting pillars to demarcate the boundary, the forest department is also digging 1.5-metre-wide and two-metre-deep protection trench along the boundary to check movement from both sides. It will help protect wild animals as they won’t be able to cross this trench, said officials.According to the latest census conducted at DTR, there are 13,697 wild animals, excluding tiger and leopard, in the buffer zone division.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Uttar Pradesh: 217 cartons of illicit li.description: BAREILLY: Launching a crackdown on liquor mafia, police on Sunday seized as many as 217 cartons of illicit liquor in Sambhal and arrested an accused. According to police, the estimated cost of the seized Haryana-made liquor is around Rs 2 lakh, the sale of which is prohibited in Uttar Pradesh. The arrested man has been identified as Shyamraj Singh. Chandausi circle officer Poonam Mishra said after receiving a tip-off that truck container carrying illicit liquor in huge quantity would pass through Chandausi, police had taken position near Majhavali crossing in Behjoi. “We have seized 217 cartons of Haryana-made illicit liquor, the cost of which is around Rs 2 lakh. An FIR under relevant sections of the Excise Act was registered,” said CO. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

14-year-old boy suffers epilepsy attack.description: BAREILLY: A 14-year-old boy was drowned after he fell into a drain following an epilepsy attack in Sambhal on Tuesday morning. According to police, Raees sells biryani in Kotla locality under Hayatnagar police station of Sambhal. On Tuesday morning, his 14-year-old son Arshad, an epilepsy patient, was sitting near a drain when he suffered an epilepsy attack and fell into drain and was drowned. When his father did not find him, he raised an alarm. Later, locals fished out his body from the drain. Station house officer of Hayatnagar police station Ranveer Singh said, “The teenager had been undergoing treatment for epilepsy for the past eight years. I have seen his medical records. He fell into the drain following an epilepsy attack. Though drain is not deep, the boy could not be saved.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bareilly: Dreaded criminal and constable.description: BAREILLY: Wanted in several cases registered against him in Sambhal district, police arrested noted history-sheeter Sameer alias Shahroz aka Dulhe Miyan after a prolonged gun battle on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. One police constable also sustained bullet injuries during encounter. Both injured were taken hospital where doctors said that they were out of danger. During encounter, taking advantage of dark Sameer’s accomplice managed to flee the scene. Police kept continue combing operation to nab him but in vain. Police have lodged FIR in the matter. Police were on routine checking near Gavan village when they signaled motorbike borne two youths around 10 pm coming from Anupshahr side. Instead of following police directions, they accelerated the vehicle and ran towards Sambhal. Meanwhile, police alerted Hayatnagar police station and the cops had encircled them near Shakurpur village. Sooner, the miscreants opened fire on police party having found themselves encircled leaving a constable Kuldeep Kumar injured who sustained bullet injuries in his left arm. “In our defence we also opened fire and nabbed one accused while the other one was disappeared in cane fields. Sameer had been wanted in several cases lodged against him including cow slaughtering,” Superintendent of police, Yamuna Prasad said. The accused culprit also sustained bullet injuries in his leg. Police recovered a country made pistol, live cartridges and a motorbike from his possession. An FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) and Arms Act was lodged against Sameer and his absconding accomplice. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Youth shot at in Kheri for shooing off m.description: BAREILLY: A law student suffered bullet injury after two groups allegedly clashed and exchanged fire on the issue of shooing off monkeys in Ratanpur village under jurisdiction of Pasgavan police station in Lakhimpur Kheri district on Thursday evening, said police. According to the police, Somendra Yadav was rushed to a local hospital, from where he was referred for a higher medical centre in Shahjahanpur and then to a Bareilly hospital. According to Dr Anurag Parashar at Shahjahanpur district hospital, “A bullet struck the 26-year-old man into his stomach and made its way out. His condition is serious.” Circle officer Shrestha Thakur said, “Two groups clashed over shooing away monkeys and in the ensuing gun battle, one youth was injured and sent to hospital. Police force has been deployed in Ratanpur and we are trying to identify the accused and have been conducting raids to nab them.” According to CO, the situation is under control. Since, no complaint had been lodged from either sides, an FIR was yet to be registered in the matter, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Bareilly: Five-year-old missing girl fou.description: BAREILLY: A five-year-old girl who went missing on June 3 from Baradari area of Bareilly city was traced to an orphanage on Tuesday morning. The missing girl was living in the orphanage ever since she was dropped there by a stranger who found her lying unattended on a footpath. As she was unable to give any information about her parents or where she lived, he took her to the orphanage. It was only when the local police circulated her pictures to other police stations that the girl was identified. The girl will be handed over to her family after a medical examination. According to police, the girl was playing outside her house on the evening of June 3, when she spotted a candy-floss seller and went after him. In doing so, she lost her way. Her parents searching for her everywhere but when they failed to find her, they thought that their daughter had been kidnapped. On the basis of their complaint, an FIR under IPC sections 363 (kidnapping a minor) was registered by police. After the girl was found in the orphanage, she was taken into custody of child welfare department. The girl's family was informed and they were allowed to meet her. Since an FIR was registered in this case, so proper disposal of this case will be done through court order. The family is expected to get the custody of their girl after two days. "We spent sleepless nights thinking about our daughter. I was continuously praying for her as all the newspapers nowadays are full of news about crime against minor girls. Thankfully, my daughter is fine,” said her father. Satish Yadav, SHO, Baradari police station, told TOI, “We were searching for the missing girl and fortunately, she was found in an orphanage situated in the limits of Kotwali police station in the city. We spoke with the orphanage management and found everything is fine. The girl had lost her way after leaving her home. She was brought to the orphanage by a local.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Rs 32,000 from army personnel\u2019s acc.description: BAREILLY: Army personnel Mahendra Kumar, who is posted at Bareilly cantonment, has lodged a complaint with senior superintendent of police, alleging that Rs 32,000 was withdrawn from his saving bank account in four transections from an ATM located at Bhutonwali Gali in Delhi using cloned debit card. Notably, Kumar has a saving bank account with SBI Narnaul branch in Haryana. Following the complaint, SSP Muniraj instructed the cyber cell to investigate the matter. Kumar, a native of Haryana, is a Havildar and has been posted with the Army supply core here. According to Kumar, the last transaction he had made was in Bareilly on June 2. “Except Bareilly and Narnaul, I have never withdrawn money either in Delhi or elsewhere. I last withdrew money from a Bareilly ATM on June 2 and before that I had visited an ATM in Narnaul. My debit card is also with me,” he said. Providing transection details he told police that all four transections were carried out on June 5 through a cloned card. SSP said the matter was sent to the cyber cell and after investigation an FIR would be registered under appropriate sections. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Man learns about daughter\u2019s affair,.description: BAREILLY: After learning about his 15-year-old daughter’s affair with a cousin, a man allegedly tried to stab her to death. He was helped by his son. Assuming that she was dead, the father-son duo dumped her at Pasgawa village on Friday night. However, passersby saw the injured girl lying near the state highway and informed police. The girl was immediately rushed to the district hospital in Shahjahanpur. After undergoing treatment, the girl’s condition improved and she regained consciousness on Saturday. In a statement to police, the girl said she was a resident of Roza area and in a relationship with the son of her aunt. However, her father was against their match and had fixed her marriage elsewhere. When she refused to marry the man chosen by her father, he along with her elder brother allegedly strangled her and stabbed her with a knife. After recording her statement, police have filed an FIR against her father and brother under IPC section 307 (attempt to murder). Both are on the run. The injured girl is being taken care of by her elder sister and aunt in hospital. Additional SP (city) Dinesh Tripathi also visited the hospital and spoke with the girl. He said, “The girl was found in an unconscious condition with multiple injures. She was treated at the district hospital, where her condition is stable. She has alleged that her father and brother attempted to kill her. We are investigating the case.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. No helmet, no petrol: Bikers get three d.description: PILIBHIT: District magistrate Vaibhav Shrivastav on Friday extended by three days the enforcement of his order of not refuelling bikes of the riders without a helmet. On Friday, a delegation of petroleum dealers’ association met DM and sought extension in the enforcement of his order so that bikers could be sensitised about the newly-imposed safety measure. The DM’s order was scheduled to be enforced from June 14 with the objective of protecting the bikers from fatal accidents. According to assistant regional transport officer Amitabh Rai, “We, sub-divisional magistrates of all five tehsil circles and I, have been checking petrol pumps since morning hours for the compliance of the safety order. The district has nearly 2.4 lakh vehicle, including commercial, agricultural and private passenger vehicles, of which bikes accounted for a major part with 1.9 lakh.” After we found bikers without helmets were getting refuelled at many petrol pumps, fine was imposed on 36 bikers. When we sought pump owners’ response over refuelling of offenders’ bikes, they said ‘the bikers in general were not aware of the DM’s order’,” Rai said. Asked about petrol pumps management’s apprehension about illicit practice of providing helmets at a nominal rent to bikers without helmet for refuelling, Rai said this could hamper the prime objective of the order. “This situation will be tackled stringently,” he added. According to district president, petroleum dealers’ association, Alok Goel, the district has a total of 91 petrol pumps and all have been directed to display the new order prominently. But, at the same time, he feared the refusal to refuelling bikes of offenders could lead to a volatile situation. Rai said police would provide security guards to all major petrol pumps for their safety. ARTO, however, said bikers ferrying patients or facing some emergency situation would be exempted from the order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BDA comes up with a \u2018rider\u2019 to.description: Bareilly: In order to attract people to book houses made under the Pradhan Mantri Awasya Yojana-Urban (PMAY-U) at Ramganga Nagar, the Bareilly Development Authority (BDA) announced free bus service for prospective buyers seeking to visit the site. The three-day service that began on Wednesday saw a ridership of 100 people, officials said on Friday. Under the PMAY initiative, the government aims to provide affordable housing for urban poor with a target of building 20 million houses by March 31, 2022. According to officials, only 300 people have got registered for residential flats after paying the registration fee while many have not turned up to pay the installment amount. At present, around 400 flats have been completed while the construction of more flats is underway. However, the BDA officials said the affordable houses constructed at Ramganfa Nagar has not found many takers due to its distance from the city. The BDA is currently accepting registrations at the special camps organised at its office and the last date of registration is June 15. People can avail free bus service to visit the site till the last day of the camp, said officials. Speaking to TOI, BDA secretery AK Singh said, “Many have availed the bus service which was launched by BDA to facilitate people and provide them a view of the houses. The move is aimed at providing conveyance to people interested and willing to buy the houses. As the Ramganga Nagar Awasya Yojana is located on the outskirts of the city, many people feel reluctant to visit the site and due to this, the residential scheme hasn’t been popular among the public. Thus, to give it a boost, we have been providing free trip for the people.” He added, “With last date of the registeration approaching, the number of people visiting the camp has risen. Around 100 people were taken to visit the site through the special bus over the last two days. Since the location is far from the city limits, only one ride is possible. We may increase the trip based on the requirement on the final day.” BDA officials hope that the move will help in quick booking of the houses under the scheme. Ram Singh, a resident of Sindhu Nagar said, “The residential plots are located on the outskirts. It is around 20 km far from my house. I have just learnt that tomorrow is the last day to avail of the bus service. I will try to visit the site and hopefully will book a house.” Under PMAY, the cost of a finished flat is Rs 4 lakh, but the flats are available for Rs 2 lakh, as a subsidy of Rs 1.5 lakh is being provided by the Centre and the remaining Rs 1 lakh by the state government. Thus, a beneficiary needs to pay the remaining amount of Rs 1.75 lakh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi used the first all-party meeting called after the elections to push for his "One Nation, One Election" idea at a meeting of leaders of political parties to be held on June 19. Making the announcement at the usual meeting of political parties called on the eve of the 17th Lok Sabha convening on Monday, Modi said Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". Wednesday's meeting is to also discuss how Parliament can be made more productive. Modi's invite extends to presidents of all the parties with presence in Parliament. Besides "One Nation, One Election", the meeting would discuss celebration of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said. SP workers submit memorandum on increasi.description: BAREILLY: Following their party chief Akhilesh Yadav’s instructions, scores of Samajwadi Party workers on Saturday gathered at Damodar park here and marched to the collectorate and submitted a five-point memorandum, addressed to the President, to city magistrate Sanjay Singh. SP’s former district unit secretary Haider Ali said over the past two weeks as many as 72 people were killed and 24 rape cases reported from different parts of the state. “We demanded from the President to sack the BJP government immediately and impose President rule as the law and order in UP has completely deteriorated,” he said. In the memorandum, SP workers demanded a compensation of Rs 1 crore for kin of slain UP Bar council president Darvesh Yadav, who was shot dead in a broad daylight. The agitated workers also raised the matter of police assault on journalists in the state. “Every day, at least one rape case of minor girl is reported in the state and police are sitting as mute and deaf,” said Haider. In the absence of DM at the collectorate, the agitating workers handed over the memorandum to the city magistrate. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Teachers allege scam in training program.description: BAREILLY: Bareilly district magistrate has ordered an inquiry on Thursday after teachers of primary school under the aegis of Uttar Pradeshiye Prathamik Shikshak Sangh alleged embezzlement of funds in the training programme conducted in March this year. The teachers alleged that while most of them did not attend the training programme due to annual examinations and evaluation of answer sheets, a few officials misused funds meant to be given to teachers as travelling and dearness allowances. District magistrate VK Singh said, “After members of teachers’ association met me, I forwarded their complaint to the basic shiksha adhikari and asked her to conduct an inquiry into the matter.” Arun Mishra, Bareilly district secretary of Uttar Pradeshiye Prathamik Shikshak Sangh, said, “A short (2-5 days) training under ‘Padhe Bharat Badhe Bharat’ and ‘U-dise’ programmes for around 4,000 teachers of 2,099 primary schools took place at their respective block research centre in March. However, as most of the teachers were occupied with annual exams and evaluation of answer copies, they skipped the training.” “A teacher had to receive travelling allowance of Rs 1 per kilometre for all days of training. However, none of the teachers received travelling allowance while most part of dearness allowance was also saved. Block education officers along with a few assistant block research coordinators embezzled funds. We want a departmental inquiry into this and action should be taken against those responsible,” said Mishra. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

After kin oppose marriage, couple commit.description: BAREILLY: A 20-year-old boy and 19-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide after consuming poison as their families were opposed to their relationship. The incident happened at Thura Bela village under Banda police station of Shahjahanpur at about 2 am on Thursday. According to Harpal Singh, station officer, Banda police station, “Both boy and girl belonged to same caste but their families opposed their relationship as they did not want them to marry them in the same village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.” According to police, Ajaypal alias Sachin (22) and Mamta (20) were in a relationship for the past two years. They wanted to marry each other but their families were opposed to their marriage. The two left their homes around midnight and met in a field near a canal. Police said after consuming poison around 2 am, they called their respective family members to inform them about the extreme step. Their families rushed to the spot and took them to the community health centre, but doctors declared them dead on arrival. Kali Charan, youth’s father, said, “After I got a call from my son, I called up Dial 100 team and informed them. We took them to the CHC but failed to save them. The girl’s family had objected to their marriage.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ex-lover stabs woman in Moradabad.description: Bareilly: A 22-year-old woman, Tarannum, was stabbed to death allegedly by her former lover, Ghulam Ali, at his residence in Jayantipur locality under Majhola police station area in Moradabad on Monday night. He fled from the spot as she lay bleeding. She called Dial 100 police. By the time, she was rushed to hospital, she was dead. Waseem was booked for murder. According to police, the woman had been in a relationship with accused before she got married with one Waseem a few months ago. He had called her to his house, where he allegedly stabbed her after a heated argument. Slain woman’s brother-in-law Mushahid claimed that Ali had been harassing his sister-in-law ever since she got married. “Ali had her pictures in his mobile and used to blackmail her. On Monday night, he called her up on her mobile phone and asked to come to come to his house,” he added. “We are conducting raids to nab the accused who will be in our custody very soon,” said SHO Sensar Pal. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kheri farmer dies after tree falls on hi.description: Bareilly: A 40-year-old farmer died after the branch of a tree fell on him following a dust storm in Bhagatpur village under Gola sub-division of Lakhimpur Kheri district on Wednesday. According to police, Madhav Ram (40) was working in a field around 7 am when the incident took place. Ram sustained severe head injuries after which he was taken to a nearby community health centre in Gola, but the doctors declared him dead on arrival. Sub-divisional magistrate of Gola, S Sudhakaran, said, “As Madhav Ram’s death comes under natural calamity, his family will get a compensation of Rs 4 lakh. We will send a report to the higher authorities in this regard.” Apart from Ram, officials said two cattle in Bakeganj of Lakhimpur Kheri district in the dust storm.
